intro: Argemone platyceras var. rosea, commonly known as the rose-colored argemone, is a variant of the argemone plant characterized by its distinctive pink to rose-colored flowers. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant features a hairy, upright stem with lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. Its flowers are typically solitary and have a striking, showy appearance with prominent yellow stamens. The seeds of this plant are encased in a hard, spiny capsule and are often used in traditional medicine.
